basics.name: Mallorga Yuliana
basics.label: Full Stack Developer
summary: Full Stack Web Developer with 3 years of experience in building modern, and efficient web applications. Specialized in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, with expertise in frameworks like React, Vite, Bootstrap, Tailwind, and Astro, as well as backend technologies such as Node.js and Express.js. Additionally, experienced in databases like PostgreSQL.

Passionate about developing high-quality software, applying best practices such as Clean Code. Skilled in responsive web design, ensuring adaptable and optimized interfaces across different devices. Strong team player with experience in project management, having served as a Scrum Master in two projects.
Committed to continuous learning and the adoption of cutting-edge technologies to develop innovative, and high-performance solutions.

achievements: Developed a web application using React, Vite, and Tachyons, improving the UI/UX experience.
Integrated a REST API (Clarifai) using Axios for efficient data consumption.
Implemented the backend with Node.js and Express.js, managing the database with PostgreSQL.
Deployed the application to the cloud for public access on the render platform.
highlights: Full Stack Developer with experience in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, Vite, Astro Bootstrap, Tailwind, Node.js, Express.js and PostgreSQL.
Implementation of RESTful APIs and optimization of SQL databases.
Experience with cloud deployment using Render.

achievements: I led agile development using Scrum, managing sprints, daily standups, and coordinating the team through Trello.
We developed the application using React.js, Bootstrap, Chart.js, and various libraries for the user interface, data handling, and optimization.
We developed the application using React.js, Bootstrap, Chart.js, and various libraries for the user interface, data handling, and optimization.
I collaborated on creating essential front-end components, such as Contact, Login (with validation), Register, Us, Navbar and Footer.
Improved backend functionality, adding login validation and extending the user schema with img, role, and estate fields.
highlights: Full Stack Developer with experience in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, Bootstrap, Node.js.
Implementation of RESTful APIs and optimization of NoSQL databases.
Experience with cloud deployment using Netlify.
Work in agile teams with Scrum and GitHub Projects.

achievements: I led agile development using Scrum, managing sprints, daily standups, and coordinating the team through Trello.
We developed the application using HTML, CSS, Vanilla JS, and JSON files, incorporating Bootstrap and SweetAlert2 to improve the user experience.
I collaborated on the creation of essential front-end components, such as the Contact, Error404, and About pages, the Navbar, and the Footer.
highlights: Full Stack Developer with experience in HTML, CSS, JavaScript.
Implementation of json file to simulate a API.
Experience with cloud deployment using Netlify and Render.
Work in agile teams with Scrum and GitHub Projects.

education.title: Full stack developer
education.summary: At RollingCode, I developed foundational tech skills, set up my work environment with Linux and VS Code, and collaborated in team projects, serving as Scrum Master in the last two. I gained experience with Git/GitHub, JavaScript, Node.js, and React.js, using HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, and SweetAlert2 for UI. I worked with JSON, consumed APIs with Axios, and implemented JWT authentication. This experience enhanced my problem-solving and communication skills in an agile environment.

education.title: Web developer
education.summary: At Zero to Mastery, I took my basic skills to the next level with the Web Developer course, where I worked with technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and React.js for building dynamic interfaces, as well as managing styles with Tachyons. I also improved my skills in Git and GitHub for version control. On the backend, I gained experience with Node.js and Express.js, interacting with SQL databases like PostgreSQL. I also used Postman to test and debug REST APIs, handling data formats in JSON. Thanks to this course, I strengthened my Problem-Solving skills by optimizing application performance and improving functionality with tools like Axios for managing HTTP requests.

projects.name: Blog anime
projects.description: This project is a website with an anime blog theme. On our page, you will find different sections such as the image gallery, about us, login, contact, in addition to the home page. Our website is carefully designed with an attractive and easy to navigate interface, created with HTML and CSS.

projects.name: Filmax
projects.description: The project consists of a web page with a catalog of movies and series, in the style of Netflix, HBO Max, Cuevana, among other examples. Here you can see, add, edit, delete movies and series, through an admin page. It also allows registering and entering a user.

projects.name: WorldSurveys
projects.description: It is an app made with ReactJS with a survey theme, in which the admin can register surveys, modify them, view them and delete them. In it, tools such as React Router Dom are used to manage the routes that allow us to navigate between the different pages and JSON Server to simulate an external API.

projects.name: Background-Generator-Project
projects.description: This project is used to generate gradient backgrounds.

projects.name: Twitter Follow Card
projects.description: The Twitter Follow Card Component project focuses on developing a custom component for web applications using React. This component will allow developers to easily integrate Twitter follow cards into their sites with customization options. Vite is used as the development environment, and ESLint rules are applied to maintain code quality.

projects.name: Tic-Tac-Toe Game
projects.description: The 'Tic-Tac-Toe Game' is a project that creates an online version of the classic 'Tic-Tac-Toe' game. It uses React and React DOM to develop the user interface, Vite as the development environment, and ESLint rules to ensure clean code. Two players compete in real-time, and when one wins, it appears on the screen, ending the game.

projects.name: Mouse follower
projects.description: The 'Mouse follower' is a React project that follows the mouse pointer with an animation. It uses the useState and useEffect hooks to enable and disable mouse tracking.

projects.name: React technical test
projects.description: The project consists of a web page as part of a technical test for React beginners and learners. It consumes two APIs and follows these instructions: First, a random fact about cats is recorded from the first API. Second, the first three words of the fact are extracted. Third, an image of a cat is displayed with the first three words of the previous fact.

projects.name: React Movie Search
projects.description: The 'React Movie Search' is a React project that displays movies whose data is provided by an API. Movies can be automatically searched for by typing into a form field.

projects.name: Chatgpt local
projects.description: The 'Chatgpt local' project implements a local chat interface using the GPT language model. It allows you to ask questions and receive responses generated by the GPT model privately and without an internet connection.

projects.name: Astro demo
projects.description: The 'Astro Demo' project renders SpaceX launches, using Tailwind CSS to style the site and TypeScript to handle logic and code typing, ensuring better scalability and maintainability. Additionally, it integrates with an API to fetch real-time launch information.

projects.name: Pending Task React Ts
projects.description: The 'Pending Task React' TS Project is an application that allows users to add and delete tasks entered through an input field. It is built with React and TypeScript, ensuring a more structured and maintainable codebase.

projects.name: Facial Recognition Project (Frontend)
projects.description: The Facial Recognition Project is an application designed to detect faces in images provided by the user via a link. To access the application, the user must register or log in and then enter the image link into an input field.

projects.name: facial-recognition-API-Back-end (Backend)
projects.description: The 'facial-recognition-API-Back-end' project is an application built with Node.js and Express.js to manage the backend of the facial recognition system. It handles user registration and login, as well as tracking the number of processed images. Additionally, it uses PostgreSQL as a database to store user information and interactions. The API has been tested and documented with Postman to ensure proper functionality.
